name: nforwardauth
description: nForwardAuth is a self-hosted identity provider and authentication proxy that centralizes login through OAuth2 with routing rules and session forwarding. Designed for protecting internal apps.
features: OAuth2 authentication: Centralize login using OAuth2 providers like Google, GitHub, or custom IdPs.
Forward auth proxy: Protect internal applications by intercepting requests and validating sessions.
Routing rules: Define which applications require authentication and which are publicly accessible.
Session management: Handle user sessions with secure cookies and token validation.
SSO experience: Single sign-on across multiple applications with one authentication.
Access control: Restrict application access based on user groups, roles, or email domains.
Logout handling: Centralized logout that clears sessions across all protected applications.
Custom redirects: Configure post-login and post-logout redirect URLs for user flow.
Header injection: Pass user information to backend applications via HTTP headers.
Reverse proxy integration: Works with Traefik, Nginx, and other reverse proxies.
Lightweight design: Minimal resource footprint suitable for edge deployment.
Self-hosted control: Keep authentication data and user sessions on your own infrastructure.
